member.name: T:Dapper.SimpleCRUD
member.summary: Main class for Dapper.SimpleCRUD extensions
Main class for Dapper.SimpleCRUD extensions

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.GetDialect
member.summary: Returns the current dialect name

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.SetDialect(Dapper.SimpleCRUD.Dialect)
member.summary: Sets the database dialect

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.SetTableNameResolver(Dapper.SimpleCRUD.ITableNameResolver)
member.summary: Sets the table name resolver
member.param: The resolver to use when requesting the format of a table name

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.SetColumnNameResolver(Dapper.SimpleCRUD.IColumnNameResolver)
member.summary: Sets the column name resolver
member.param: The resolver to use when requesting the format of a column name

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.Get``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: By default queries the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
By default filters on the Id column
-Id column name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your primary key property [Key]
Supports transaction and command timeout
Returns a single entity by a single id from table T

member.returns: Returns a single entity by a single id from table T.

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.GetList``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: By default queries the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
whereConditions is an anonymous type to filter the results ex: new {Category = 1, SubCategory=2}
Supports transaction and command timeout
Returns a list of entities that match where conditions

member.returns: Gets a list of entities with optional exact match where conditions

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.GetList``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: By default queries the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
conditions is an SQL where clause and/or order by clause ex: "where name='bob'" or "where age>=@Age"
parameters is an anonymous type to pass in named parameter values: new { Age = 15 }
Supports transaction and command timeout
Returns a list of entities that match where conditions

member.returns: Gets a list of entities with optional SQL where conditions

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.GetList``1(System.Data.IDbConnection)

summary.para: By default queries the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
Returns a list of all entities

member.returns: Gets a list of all entities

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.GetListPaged``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: By default queries the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
conditions is an SQL where clause ex: "where name='bob'" or "where age>=@Age" - not required
orderby is a column or list of columns to order by ex: "lastname, age desc" - not required - default is by primary key
parameters is an anonymous type to pass in named parameter values: new { Age = 15 }
Supports transaction and command timeout
Returns a list of entities that match where conditions

member.returns: Gets a paged list of entities with optional exact match where conditions

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.Insert(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: Inserts a row into the database
By default inserts into the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
Insert filters out Id column and any columns with the [Key] attribute
Properties marked with attribute [Editable(false)] and complex types are ignored
Supports transaction and command timeout
Returns the ID (primary key) of the newly inserted record if it is identity using the int? type, otherwise null

member.returns: The ID (primary key) of the newly inserted record if it is identity using the int? type, otherwise null

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.Insert``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: Inserts a row into the database
By default inserts into the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
Insert filters out Id column and any columns with the [Key] attribute
Properties marked with attribute [Editable(false)] and complex types are ignored
Supports transaction and command timeout
Returns the ID (primary key) of the newly inserted record if it is identity using the defined type, otherwise null

member.returns: The ID (primary key) of the newly inserted record if it is identity using the defined type, otherwise null

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.Update(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: Updates a record or records in the database
By default updates records in the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
Updates records where the Id property and properties with the [Key] attribute match those in the database.
Properties marked with attribute [Editable(false)] and complex types are ignored
Supports transaction and command timeout
Returns number of rows effected

member.returns: The number of effected records

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.Delete``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,``0,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: Deletes a record or records in the database that match the object passed in
-By default deletes records in the table matching the class name
Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
Supports transaction and command timeout
Returns the number of records effected

member.returns: The number of records effected

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.Delete``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: Deletes a record or records in the database by ID
By default deletes records in the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
Deletes records where the Id property and properties with the [Key] attribute match those in the database
The number of records effected
Supports transaction and command timeout

member.returns: The number of records effected

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.DeleteList``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: Deletes a list of records in the database
By default deletes records in the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
Deletes records where that match the where clause
whereConditions is an anonymous type to filter the results ex: new {Category = 1, SubCategory=2}
The number of records effected
Supports transaction and command timeout

member.returns: The number of records effected

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.DeleteList``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: Deletes a list of records in the database
By default deletes records in the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
Deletes records where that match the where clause
conditions is an SQL where clause ex: "where name='bob'" or "where age>=@Age"
parameters is an anonymous type to pass in named parameter values: new { Age = 15 }
Supports transaction and command timeout

member.returns: The number of records effected

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.RecordCount``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: By default queries the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
Returns a number of records entity by a single id from table T
Supports transaction and command timeout
conditions is an SQL where clause ex: "where name='bob'" or "where age>=@Age" - not required
parameters is an anonymous type to pass in named parameter values: new { Age = 15 }

member.returns: Returns a count of records.

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.RecordCount``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

member.name: M:Dapper.SimpleCRUD.InsertAsync(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Nullable{System.Int32})

summary.para: Inserts a row into the database asynchronously
By default inserts into the table matching the class name
-Table name can be overridden by adding an attribute on your class [Table("YourTableName")]
Insert filters out Id column and any columns with the [Key] attribute
Properties marked with attribute [Editable(false)] and complex types are ignored
Supports transaction and command timeout
Returns the ID (primary key) of the newly inserted record if it is identity using the int? type, otherwise null

member.name: T:Dapper.TableAttribute
member.summary: Optional Table attribute. You can use the System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations version in its place to specify the table name of a poco

member.name: M:Dapper.TableAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Optional Table attribute.

member.name: P:Dapper.TableAttribute.Name
member.summary: Name of the table

member.name: P:Dapper.TableAttribute.Schema
member.summary: Name of the schema

member.name: T:Dapper.ColumnAttribute
member.summary: Optional Column attribute. You can use the System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations version in its place to specify the table name of a poco

member.name: M:Dapper.ColumnAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Optional Column attribute.

member.name: P:Dapper.ColumnAttribute.Name
member.summary: Name of the column

member.name: T:Dapper.KeyAttribute
member.summary: Optional Key attribute. You can use the System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations version in its place to specify the Primary Key of a poco

member.name: T:Dapper.NotMappedAttribute
member.summary: Optional NotMapped attribute. You can use the System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations version in its place to specify that the property is not mapped

member.name: T:Dapper.RequiredAttribute
member.summary: Optional Key attribute. You can use the System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations version in its place to specify a required property of a poco

member.name: T:Dapper.EditableAttribute
member.summary: Optional Editable attribute. You can use the System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations version in its place to specify the properties that are editable

member.name: M:Dapper.EditableAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Optional Editable attribute.

member.name: P:Dapper.EditableAttribute.AllowEdit
member.summary: Does this property persist to the database?

member.name: T:Dapper.ReadOnlyAttribute
member.summary: Optional Readonly attribute. You can use the System.ComponentModel version in its place to specify the properties that are editable

member.name: M:Dapper.ReadOnlyAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Optional ReadOnly attribute.

member.name: P:Dapper.ReadOnlyAttribute.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Does this property persist to the database?

member.name: T:Dapper.IgnoreSelectAttribute
member.summary: Optional IgnoreSelect attribute. Custom for Dapper.SimpleCRUD to exclude a property from Select methods

member.name: T:Dapper.IgnoreInsertAttribute
member.summary: Optional IgnoreInsert attribute. Custom for Dapper.SimpleCRUD to exclude a property from Insert methods

member.name: T:Dapper.IgnoreUpdateAttribute
member.summary: Optional IgnoreUpdate attribute. Custom for Dapper.SimpleCRUD to exclude a property from Update methods
